sentences.en: A muscular spasm in the coronary artery can cause a heart attack.
sentences.cn: 冠状动脉的肌肉痉挛可能导致心脏病。

sentences.en: Condensation will eventually cause the fabric of the building to rot away.
sentences.cn: 冷凝作用将最终使建筑结构腐朽掉。

sentences.en: He barnstormed across the nation, rallying the people to the cause.
sentences.cn: 他在全国四处游说，号召人们共赴大业。

sentences.en: He worked tirelessly for the cause of health and safety.
sentences.cn: 他孜孜不倦地致力于健康和安全事业。

sentences.en: Heavy traffic is causing delays on the freeway.
sentences.cn: 交通拥挤使高速公路通行不畅。

sentences.en: His misunderstanding of language was the primary cause of his other problems.
sentences.cn: 他对语言的误解是引起其他问题的主要原因。

sentences.en: I have personally been devoted to this cause for many years.
sentences.cn: 多年来我个人一直一心扑在这项事业上。

sentences.en: I think it's going to cause chaos personally but never mind.
sentences.cn: 我个人认为它会引起混乱，但是没关系。

sentences.en: I’m sorry if I caused any confusion .
sentences.cn: 对不起，我可能给大家造成了混乱。

sentences.en: Incidents of this type cause irreparable damage to relations with the community.
sentences.cn: 这类事件会对与该社群的关系造成不可弥合的伤害。

sentences.en: Indirectly, I did cause her death. I shouldn'thave left her there.
sentences.cn: 的确，她的死是我间接造成的。我不该把她留在那里。

sentences.en: Integrating the pound with other European currencies could cause difficulties.
sentences.cn: 把英镑与欧洲其他货币合并会引发许多难题。

sentences.en: Investment could dry up and that could cause the economy to falter.
sentences.cn: 投资可能会中断，而这会引起经济衰退。

sentences.en: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.cn: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.en: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.cn: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

sentences.en: nationalist movements &B{made common cause with} the reformers.
sentences.cn: 民族主义运动与改革派联合起来。

sentences.en: Never force your legs to overstretch, or you can cause injuries.
sentences.cn: 千万不要迫使双腿过度拉伸，否则会受伤的。

sentences.en: Sorry, I didn’t mean to cause offence (= offend you ) .
sentences.cn: 对不起，我不是故意要冒犯你。

sentences.en: The facts could cause embarrassment if they ever became public.
sentences.cn: 一旦披露出去，真相会让人非常尴尬。

sentences.en: The fire caused £15,000 worth of damage.
sentences.cn: 这场火灾造成了价值1.5万英镑的损失。

sentences.en: The insecticide used on some weeds can cause health problems.
sentences.cn: 喷洒在野草上的杀虫剂会引发各种健康问题。

sentences.en: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.cn: 不必惊慌。

sentences.en: This was a genuine mistake, but it did cause me some worry.
sentences.cn: 这是好心办错事，可是确实让我担心了一阵子。

sentences.en: We admire her dedication to the cause of humanity.
sentences.cn: 我们敬佩她对人类事业的献身精神。

phrases.tran_cn: 无由的反叛者(对社会不满但没有具体奋斗目标的人)
共同事业；共同目标协会；偶然原因；普通原因
可能的原因；合理的根据

trans.tran_en: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen
to make something happen, especially something bad

trans.tran_cn: 造成，引起；使得；使遭受，给…带来
trans.tran_en: To cause something, usually something bad, means to make it happen
